column2: for he had not eaten all that day; so he did not waste much anger upon the tub
column3: but took up the black loaf
column5: and then spat out the bite
column6: for the bread was hard and mouldy. Still he did not give way to his wrath
column7: for he had not drunken these many hours; having a hope of heath beer or wine at his day's end
column8: he had left the brooks untasted
column9: to make his supper the more delightful. Now he put the jug to his lips
column10: but he flung it from him straightway
column11: for the water was bitter and ill-smelling. Then he gave the jug a kick
column12: so that it broke against the opposite wall
column13: and he took down the blanket to wrap it about him for the night. But no sooner did he touch it than it was alive with skipping fleas.
